hr.vestigo.java.tecaj.zadaca4.garden

Interface Plot

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Flowerbed, Orchard

    public interface Plot
    Plot interface. Interface which describes one garden plot in which plants can be planted.
    Author:
    Šimun

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int capacity
      capacity is a constant, number of plants that can be planted on one plot.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addPlant(int i, Plantable p)
      Method that adds a plant p on the i-th place in the plot (i starts at 0).
      void addWater()
      Method which waters all plants on plot.
      int countPlants()
      Counts the number of plants on the plot.
      Plantable getPlant(int i)
      Method which returns what plant is planted on position i.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Method which prints all the plants on the plot in a formatted way.

    • Field Detail

      • capacity

        static final int capacity
        capacity is a constant, number of plants that can be planted on one plot.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • addPlant

        boolean addPlant(int i,
                 Plantable p)
          throws InvalidPlantType,
                 SpaceOccupiedException
        Method that adds a plant p on the i-th place in the plot (i starts at 0).
        Parameters:
        i - Position in plot where the plant is to be planted.
        p - Plantable to be planted.
        Returns:
        true if the plant was succesfully planted.
        Throws:
        InvalidPlantType - Exception thrown in case the plant type does not match the plot type.
        SpaceOccupiedException - Exception thrown in case the space i is already occupied.

      • getPlant

        Plantable getPlant(int i)
        Method which returns what plant is planted on position i.
        Parameters:
        i - Position on the plot for which we inquire the planted plant.
        Returns:
        Plantable at position i. If no plant is planted, returns null.

      • countPlants

        int countPlants()
        Counts the number of plants on the plot.
        Returns:
        Number of plants on plot.

      • addWater

        void addWater()
        Method which waters all plants on plot.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Method which prints all the plants on the plot in a formatted way.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Some trivial string (e.g. "0").
